sentence.Network_en: He takes umbrage against anyone who criticises him.
sentence.Network_cn: 不管谁批评他，他都心生愤懑。

sentence.Network_en: I invited her because I was afraid ofgiving umbrage.
sentence.Network_cn: 我邀请了她,因为我怕得罪她.

sentence.Network_en: Everything gives umbrage to a tyrantny.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有事情都使专制君主生气.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 以u开头的英语英文单词 ... umber 棕土,焦茶色 umbrage 不快，愤怒 unabashed 不畏惧的，不害躁的.
以u开头的英语英文单词 ... umber 棕土,焦茶色 umbrage 不快，愤怒 unabashed 不畏惧的，不害躁的.
lotus dream: 英语专业考研单词背诵 ... tyro 生手, 初学者, 新手 umbrage 树荫, 不快 unabated 不衰退的, 不减弱的.
&quot;簇&quot;是什么意思啊?_爱问知识人 ... 簇新[ brand new] 簇叶[ umbrage] 簇拥[ cluster round].

list.abs: His address gave umbrage to the authorities ., 他的演说触怒了当局.
同人志贩售会情报 ... A.O.I. 的百宝箱 God umbrage 神影 L.S.E.U 柳下游鱼.
The pope himself had taken umbrage at the book ., 教皇本人对这本书曾极为生气.
Took umbrage at their rudeness ., 对他们的粗野表示不悦.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in sense 2): from Old French, from Latin umbra 'shadow'. An early sense was 'shadowy outline', giving rise to 'ground for suspicion', whence the current notion of 'offence'

entry.def: If you say that a person takes umbrage, you mean that they are upset or offended by something that someone says or does to them, often without much reason.

example.ex: He takes umbrage against anyone who criticises him.
example.tran: 不管谁批评他，他都心生愤懑。

means.word_mean: 1. a feeling of anger caused by being offended;

auth_sentence.content: The Irish might take umbrage at such perceived laurels.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Irish might take umbrage at such perceived laurels.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Irish might take umbrage at such perceived laurels.

auth_sentence.content: Stein took no umbrage at the slyly anti-Semitic comparison.
auth_sentence.res_content: Stein took no umbrage at the slyly anti-Semitic comparison.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Stein took no umbrage at the slyly anti-Semitic comparison.

auth_sentence.content: In some ways we hope that maybe Simmonds took umbrage.
auth_sentence.res_content: In some ways we hope that maybe Simmonds took umbrage.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In some ways we hope that maybe Simmonds took umbrage.

stems_affixes.word_buile: ad加强+umbr影子+ate表动词→[将来的]影子出现→预示

sentences.en: She took umbrage at my remarks about her hair.
sentences.cn: 我对她头发的评论使她很不高兴。
